content.rendered:
More DIY stores were able to open their doors today throughout France, as a result of a decree published on Tuesday authorizing establishments in the sector to temporarily derogate from Sunday rest, we learned from concordant sources.

“Thirty-three stores are open”, including 27 in Ile-de-France, or “a small third of French stores”, Jean-Claude Bourrelier, CEO of Bricorama, told AFP. The company had until then no exemption to open on Sundays, unlike its competitors, which had provoked a legal and political battle.

To give itself time to review the rules deemed too confusing, the government published a decree on December 31 authorizing establishments in the sector to temporarily derogate, until July 1, 2015, from Sunday rest. Some 178 stores under the Brico Dépôt, Bricomarché, Bricorama-Batkor, Castorama, Leroy-Merlin, Les Briconautes, Mr Bricolage and Weldom brands are affected.
